channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Namaste and a Beach Day - Perl Position in California
item.description: Our client is looking for a Perl programmer who wants to tame the job jungle for employers and employees through their candidate sourcing and data management products. We know what youâ€™re thinking: When every day is a California postcard, who needs a vacation?

item.title: Do some good in the world â€“ Perl developers required for a charity and giving-focused team in Kent
item.description: Want to do something good for once? Join the Kickstarter of the charity world, supporting activists and causes around the world. Youâ€™ll be working in Perl to support a range of their highly successful charity and giving-focused projects.

item.title: Put your Perl skills into action in a young, green city that leaves more greenbacks in your pocket
item.description: If you like the idea of an affordable city, full of folk in their 20s and 30s, with a multitude of bars and restaurants, a bustling tech sector, and surrounded by lush, green scenery then youâ€™ll like Pittsburgh. Itâ€™s a land of opportunity with the magical combo, pairing social mobility with affordability.

item.title: Front-end focus for a full stack Perl developer
item.description: If youâ€™re a full stack developer whose interest leans more towards front-end work, this role is a great opportunity for you to sharpen and deepen your front-end skills while still keeping your toes in the back-end world of Perl.

item.title: Youâ€™re Leaving, On a Jet Plane . . .
item.description: Letâ€™s face itâ€”your current job is missing something. Maybe youâ€™re sick of Gary nuking his salmon in the microwave, or maybe youâ€™ll scream if Susan sends you one more cat video. Sure, there are other jobs in your city, but maybe itâ€™s time to think bigger. You know where everything is bigger? Texas, baby!

item.title: London Perl Workshop 2019
item.description: October 19, 2019. David Game College, 31 Jewry St, London EC3N 2ET

item.title: Day Two at the SPW, or is it SPAFW or WSRAK 2019
item.description: Are the days of small conferences (workshops) numbered? Should one stop networking with fellow engineers?

item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;

item.title: With friends like these...
item.description: Amicable numbers are pairs of integers, each of which has a set of proper divisors (i.e. every smaller number by which it is evenly divisible) that happen to add up to the other number.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 21
item.description: Roger's blog started with raw calculation of e in Perl5 and Perl6. He then followed up with URL normalization with ease.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge # 21: Euler's Number and URL Normalizing
item.description: Laurent blog starts with Perl6 solution to calculate the value of e, followed by Perl5 equivalent. I was bowled by the Perl5 solution. You must check out.

item.title: PWC Week 21 - Euler's Constant and Big Numbers
item.description: Dave's blog discuss the first task about to calculate the value of e. He started with simple solution and then made it slightly difficult.

item.title: Euler's URL with Perl 6
item.description: As always, Arne's started with the magical power of Perl6. You would want more of Perl6 after reading his blog.

item.title: RECAP - Perl Weekly Challenge - 021
item.description: Review of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 022
item.description: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: Revitalize blogs.perl.org - Status Report
item.description: Not much news, but there is a new Grant Manager.

item.title: Maintaining Perl 5 (Tony Cook): July 2019 Grant Report

From SQL to Nested Data Structures
item.description: Fetching nested data structures from SQL, using DBIx::Simple and SQL::Interp.

item.title: London Perl Workshop
item.description: The London Perl Workshop is on Saturday 19th October 2019. There are more spots to speak.

item.title: Add a ton life to your business in an affordable way with StickerYou.com
item.description: StickerYou.com does more than just stickers. We allow you to brand your office, store or event with high-quality, custom decals. Make a huge impact and increase logo recall, heightening brand awareness. StickerYou.com allows you to order any size, shape and quantity. What are you waiting for? Get your office or store makeover done affordably at StickerYou.com! Use code PERL10 at checkout for an exclusive Perl Weekly discount.

item.title: #421 - Are the small conferences dead?
item.description:
Hi there

John Scoles attending the Swiss Perl Workshop had an observation that it seem all the small conferences - not only Perl - are struggling to attract visitors.

Have you noticed the same? If yes then do people attend to bigger events or even smaller and more local ones? Or do they just stay home?

Enjouy your week!
